credit_line: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
title: Temple of Curiosity
medium: Pen and ink, brush and blue and brown wash, graphite on paper off-white laid paper
description: Steps lead to a platform with seated warriors at the corners, more steps lead to the colonnade surrounding the bottom part of a circular temple.  The top of the wall at the rear of the colonnade is surrounded by a frieze.  Steps rise over the entablature upon which a tambour supports a dome.  Festoons connect bull's-eyes in the tambour.  A group of figures supporting an eye sphere is shown on a pedestal at the front side of the dome.
name: Drawing
